Articles.Content:
Is the linus kerman in the administration building named after Linus Torvalds, the inventor of the linux system for computers?

just wondering...

Could be named after Linus Pauling, or a moon orbiting 22 Kalliope.

Edit:

Scratch that, it's Linus van Pelt^[citation needed]^.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-03T14:53:01Z" title="05/03/2015 02:53  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 3, 2015</time> by Shpaget**
Probably Linus van Pelt from the Peanuts. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Or noted quantum chemist and peace activist Linus Pauling. Won the Nobel Prize for chemistry in 1954, and the Nobel Peace Prize in 1962.

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linus_Pauling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linus_Pauling)
